Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @CryptoMedication kmd can notarize pretty much any coin with a 256bit blockhash, in practice, BTC forks (and any forks of forks) are reasonable to protect, but for instance, adding dpow to Monero or ETH, while technically possible, would require a lot more work. Adding dpow to coins that invented their own internals and/or don't share much with Bitcoin don't get to use the already existing header files that KMD provides
